data.title: Ottawa Citizen
data.meta_description: Robert Ford passed away. This is the full obituary where you can express condolences and share memories. Published in the Ottawa Citizen on 2008-05-02.
data.text:
FORD, Robert D. "Blue" of Blue's Tattoos Suddenly on April 30th, 2008 after a long fight with Liver disease then ultimately Cancer, Robert "Blue" Ford passed away at the age of 55. He leaves behind his beloved wife of 23 years Corinne (nee Munday). Loving father to Tasha, Serena, Kimber-Mae (Ottawa) and Bobby (Iowa). Loved grandfather of Kamil Robert (Ottawa). Deryk, Daryan & Adrienne (Iowa). Cherished Son of Eva Mae Baker and the late Robert Riley (Iowa). Dear brother of Reggie and Shane (Iowa). He will be sadly missed by his nephews Chris and Shawn (Kingston). Private services were held Friday, May 2nd, 2008 He will be truly missed by all who knew him. Life is like a grindstone - whether it grinds you down or polishes you up depends on what you're made of. -Unknown

Published online May 2, 2008

Note: These are general guidelines; some florists may not be able to operate within these timelines. During peak periods such as Valentineâ€™s Day, Memorial Day and most holidays, florists are not always able to keep up to demand. Tribute will contact you if there are any issues.

Plant a tree: How does it work

When your purchase is complete, a post will be made on the tribute wall of the deceased signifying the planting of a memorial tree.

An official certificate recognizing your purchase will be included with your email receipt. You can then forward the email to the family or print it and give it to them personally.

After an order is placed, our forestry partners will plant the tree in the area of greatest need (nearest the funeral home), according to the planting schedule for the year.

Due to seasonal conditions, the tree planting takes place during the spring and summer.

Tree Planting Timeline

Orders placed in:

January - May

Planting will take place in Spring or Summer of the same year.

June - December

Planting will take place in Spring of the following year.
